required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Renal Outcome in Patients With COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: Renal Outcome in Patients With Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)

brief_summary.textblock: Acute kidney injury (AKI) is reported to occur in 0.5-9% of severe acute respiratory distress coronavirus 2-positive patients and AKI has been identified as an independent risk factor for in-hospital mortality. The present study aims to investigate the incidence of renal outcome of in-hospital patients diagnosed with COVID-19.

detailed_description.textblock: Beginning in December 2019, a novel coronavirus, designated as severe acute respiratory distress coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), has caused an international outbreak of respiratory illness termed coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). Although the clinical manifestations of COVID-19 are dominated by respiratory symptoms, some patients show severe kidney abnormalities. Acute kidney injury (AKI) is reported to occur in 0.5-9% of SARS-CoV-2 positive patients and AKI has been identified as an independent risk factor for in-hospital mortality. The present study aims to investigate the incidence of of renal outcome of in-hospital patients diagnosed with COVID-19.

primary_outcome.description: As determined by Kidney Disease: Improving Global Outcomes (KDIGO) criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Renal function changes during hospital stay
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from hospital admission til discharge up to 3 months

arm_group.description: Patients with COVID-19 requiring ICU care
In-hospital patients with COVID-19 not requiring ICU care

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with COVID-19 diagnosed by World Health Organisation (WHO) criteria
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged less than 18 years
- Patients with stage-5 chronic kidney disease
- Patients receiving maintenance dialysis
- Recipients of solid-organ transplantation

overall_official.affiliation: University Hospital Giessen and Marburg, Giessen

facility.name: University Hospital Giessen and Marburg, Giessen

results_reference.citation: Naicker S, Yang CW, Hwang SJ, Liu BC, Chen JH, Jha V. The Novel Coronavirus 2019 epidemic and kidneys. Kidney Int. 2020 May;97(5):824-828. doi: 10.1016/j.kint.2020.03.001. Epub 2020 Mar 7.
